question: Does any of the following situations apply to the EAW subject, in respect of the same acts on which the EAW is based?
choices: The subject received a final judgement by a Member State
The subject is being prosecuted in the Executing Member State
The subject received a final judgement by a third State

question: Does any of the following apply to the proceeding taking place in the issuing Member State?
choices: the person has been made aware of the trial
was informed that a decision may be handed down if he or she does not appear for the trial

had given a mandate to a legal counsellor, who was either appointed by the person concerned or by the State, to defend him or her at the trial, and was indeed defended by that counsellor at the trial;
being expressly informed about the right to a retrial
expressly stated that he or she does not contest the decision
did not request a retrial or appeal within the applicable time frame
was not personally served with the decision

will be personally served with it without delay after the surrender and will be expressly informed of his or her right to a retrial, or an appeal, in which the person has the right to participate and which allows the merits of the case, including fresh evidence, to be re-examined, and which may lead to the original decision being reversed
will be informed of the time frame within which he or she has to request such a retrial or appeal

question: the offence on the basis of which the European arrest warrant has been issued is punishable by custodial life sentence or life-time detention order
Has the the sentence been served?
Is the sentence currently being served
May the sentence no longer be executed under the law of the sentencing Member State
Is the criminal prosecution or punishment statute-barred according to the law of the executing Member State?
Is the subject a resident of the Executing Member State?
Information regarding the nationality of the requested person
Does the law of the executing Member State allow prosecution for the offence at issue when committed outside its territory?
Did the judicial authorities of the executing Member State decide either not to prosecute or to halt proceedings for the same offence on which the EAW is based?
Did the Italian authorities issue, for the same acts, a criminal decree of conviction, or a judgement of no grounds to proceed which is no longer subject to an appeal?
How long has the subject resided continuously in Italy (years)?
